On 18 December 2019, government troops defused a homemade bomb left by unidentified assailants outside a mansion belonging to the Ampatuan family in Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao. The incident took place ahead of a court ruling on the Ampatuan Massacre, which happened in Ampatuan, Maguindanao on 23 November 2009 and which the court later ruled to have been masterminded by key members of the Ampatuan family. That massacre saw 58 fatalities, including 32 media workers.

source: ABS CBN; Abante; Tempo (Philippines); Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine Information Agency; Manila Bulletin; GMA News
notes: On 19 December 2019, two suspected NPA militants and a supposed sympathizer were killed in a 45-minute firefight with a combined military and police team at a safehouse in Novaliches, Quezon City. Two police officers were also wounded. The military reported retrieving weapons and other items from the safehouse. The secretary of the Department of the Interior and Local Government and the National Security Adviser later claimed that the two militants were out on a mission to assassinate the president and other top government officials, though the Communist Party of the Philippines, under which the NPA operates, denied this. The NPA does not normally operate in urban areas, given its Maoist strategy of a rural-based protracted people's war.

assoc_actor_1: Bayan Muna; NUJP: National Union of Journalists of the Philippines; Journalists (Philippines)
notes: On 19 December 2019, journalists led by NUJP as well as allied groups like Bayan Muna staged a demonstration in front of Camp Bagong Diwa in Taguig, in anticipation of a court ruling on the Ampatuan Massacre, which happened in Ampatuan, Maguindanao on 23 November 2009. That massacre saw 58 fatalities, including 32 media workers. The demonstrators called for justice and demanded a guilty verdict on the massacre's masterminds. During the demonstration, the police confiscated a mural brought by the demonstrators depicting media workers fighting impunity, as they said the mural could trigger a commotion. However, the confiscation instead led to a tense confrontation between the demonstrators and the police. [size=no report]

A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed assailants along Luzuriaga Street in Valencia, Negros Oriental on 19 December 2019. The drug suspect was also a suspect in a fraud case and had just posted bail.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed assailants in Barangay Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental on 19 December 2019.
On 19 December 2019, a suspected NPA militant was killed in a firefight with the military in Mount Balatukan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental.

On 19 December 2019, the masterminds of the November 2009 Ampatuan massacre - including key members of the influential Ampatuan family - as well as around 40 others were convicted for crimes related to the killings by a special court in Camp Bagong Diwa, Taguig. The verdict was deemed a partial victory by several quarters, from journalist groups to victims' relatives, though some key acquittals left some dissatisfied. Given that around 80 suspects remain at large, there are also worries about future violence and acts of retribution in relation to the convictions. The Ampatuan Massacre happened in Ampatuan, Maguindanao on 23 November 2009 and resulted in 58 fatalities, including 32 media workers.

actor1: CPP-NPA-NDF: Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front
notes: On 22 December 2019, upon confirmation from the Office of President Rodrigo Duterte in Manila, the government of the Philippines agreed to a reciprocal Christmas season ceasefire with Communist rebels. The Communist Party of the Philippines had earlier announced the ceasefire through its political wing, the National Democratic Front, in a directive to the New People's Army, and this was to take effect upon a reciprocal announcement from the government. The ceasefire is in effect from 23 December 2019 to 7 January 2020. The president's office also announced that it had ordered the reconstitution of the government peace panel to negotiate with the Communist rebels, in a bid to restart the peace talks. The previous peace talks between the government and the Communist rebels were scrapped last November 2017.

The NPA said that the clash was an attack and was a violation of the Christmas ceasefire agreed upon by the government and the Communist Party of the Philippines. notes: On 24 December 2019, a vice mayor belonging to the powerful Ampatuan clan was wounded while his two companions were killed during an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao. The vice mayor had previously served as prosecution witness during the trial on the recently adjudicated Ampatuan Massacre, which happened in Ampatuan, Maguindanao on 23 November 2009 and left 58 fatalities. The masterminds of the Ampatuan Massacre - including key members of the Ampatuan family - as well as around 40 others were convicted for crimes related to the massacre in December 2019.

assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 24 December 2019, a former police officer was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Abgao, Malitbog, Southern Leyte. The motive for the killing was unclear.

A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Sampaloc, Talavera, Nueva Ecija on 27 December 2019.

On 27 December 2019, BIFF militants and government soldiers engaged in a firefight in Barangay Manaulanan, Pikit, Cotabato. There were no reported casualties on either side. The military retrieved 12 improvised explosive devices (IEDs) after the clash.

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Philippines)
notes: On 27 December 2019, around 2,000 drivers registered with a motorcycle taxi hailing app, as well as supporters, demonstrated in Mendiola, Manila in order to protest a recent government decision to cap the number of drivers who could register with the app to 10,000, less than half the current number of 27,000. The government likewise allowed two new competing services to enter the market. The demonstrators decried what they saw as their disenfranchisement. [size=around 2,000]

A drug suspect was killed during an encounter with the police in Barangay Dassun, Solana, Cagayan on 30 December 2019. The drug suspect supposedly refused to pull over at a checkpoint while riding a stolen motorbike.

Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Santo Cristo, San Jose del Monte, Bulacan on 31 December 2019.
On 31 December 2019, a village chairman was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion, Polomolok, South Cotabato.
